definition: Charles Darwin (1809-1882), British biologist and author of "On the Origin of Species" 物種起源|物种起源[Wu3 zhong3 Qi3 yuan2]/Darwin, capital of the Northern Territory (Australia) 北領地|北领地[Bei3 Ling3 di4]
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
Darwin, capital of the Northern Territory, Australia

pinyin: she4 hui4 Da2 er3 wen2 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: Huxley was an exponent of Darwin's theory of evolution.
sentences.chinese: 赫胥黎是达尔文进化论的鼓吹者。

sentences.english: These are the creatures that provided Darwin with the flash of imagination that led to his theory of evolution.
sentences.chinese: 这也是让达尔文灵光一现，想到了进化论的生物。

sentences.english: So here's to the impending revolution in biology. Come Darwin's 300th anniversary there will be even more to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们预祝即将来临的生物学革命。当达尔文诞生

sentences.english: We could, at long last, have a trump card to play against Darwin.
sentences.chinese: 最终，我们就有了自己的王牌，可以叫板达尔文。

sentences.english: His works were deeply influenced by physiognomy and other theories elaborated by social darwinism.
sentences.chinese: 他受相面法和­社会达尔文主义的理论影响甚深。

sentences.english: He will soon visit Darwin From there, he will fly to Perth.
sentences.chinese: 他不久还将到达尔文去，从那里，他再飞往珀斯。

sentences.english: Darvin had not seen Yao Ming up close for awhile.
sentences.chinese: 达尔文已经很久没有这么近距离的看见过姚明了。

sentences.english: Many of the people of Darwin escaped by hiding in cellars that night.
sentences.chinese: 那晚，达尔文市的许多市民是躲在地窖里逃过此劫的。

sentences.english: All Darwin perceived was that selection must work in nature, too.
sentences.chinese: 达尔文所理解的也就是自然选择，物竞天择。

sentences.english: Darwin concluded that men were descended from apes.
sentences.chinese: 达尔文的结论是人由类人猿进化而来。

sentences.english: He was flown for emergency treatment in the northern Australian city of Darwin.
sentences.chinese: 之后他乘飞机前往澳大利亚北部的达尔文市接受急救。

sentences.english: That, to a first approximation, is the neo-Darwinian account of how phenotypes evolve.
sentences.chinese: 以上基本就是新达尔文主义关于表型进化的观点。

sentences.english: Darwin would go with the ship as a naturalist and had to pay his own way.
sentences.chinese: 达尔文将作为博物学家，随船前往，费用得自付。

sentences.english: It has been supposed that Darwin renounced evolution on his deathbed.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为达尔文临死时否定了进化论。

sentences.english: Henslow, who invited Darwin to join his natural history course.
sentences.chinese: 神父邀请达尔文去听自己的自然历史课。

sentences.english: Mr Darwin was working as a prison officer at Holme House Prison in Stockton at the time.
sentences.chinese: 失踪前达尔文是斯托克顿市哈姆休斯监狱的一名警官。

definition: Keynes (name)/John Maynard Keynes (1883-1946), influential British economist
Newton (name)/Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Huxley (name)/Thomas Henry Huxley (1825-1895), British evolutionary scientist and champion of Darwin/Aldous Huxley (1894-1963), British novelist
